issue.title: Failing with 429 errors
issue.body:
### Environment

2.11.0

### Steps to Reproduce

Our nightly dev builds running on our CI service (Circle CI) have started routinely failing over the last week at the end of our workflow when we create the release in Sentry, normally on the upload dSYM step. 

After uploading a build to TestFlight our workflow uses sentry CLI to:

* Create a release and deploy in sentry. 
* Set the commits for that release. 
* Upload the dSYM. 

This workflow has worked reliably for months but now it regularly fails due to an HTTP 429 error. 

### Expected Result

Our workflow completes successfully. 

### Actual Result

```
..
[00:16:43]: > Found 1 debug information file
[00:16:43]: > Prepared debug information file for upload
[00:16:43]: error: API request failed
[00:16:43]: caused by: sentry reported an error: unknown error (http status: 429)p
[00:16:43]: ------------------------
```

issue.title: Can't seem to upload .symbols (produced by `flutter build`) files to Sentry
issue.body:
### Environment

**Sentry-cli version:** 2.21.2
**OS Version:** MacOS M1 Runner as well as locally (MacOS Ventura 13.6)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build Flutter application via `flutter build ipa` passing `--split-debug-info=path/to/symbols/directory`. A `.symbols` file is produced at the provided path.
2. Invoke `sentry_upload_dsym` passing `dsym_path` as the path provided in Step 1
3. See the following logs:
```console
2023-10-16T19:50:15.8691910Z [19:50:15]: > Found 0 debug information files
2023-10-16T19:50:15.8693460Z [19:50:15]: > No debug information files found
```

### Expected Result

Symbols files should be uploaded the same way native dSYMs are. In the case of our native dSYMs we see:
```console
023-10-16T19:50:16.9752320Z [19:50:16]: > Found 60 debug information files
2023-10-16T19:50:17.5732710Z [19:50:17]: > Prepared debug information files for upload
2023-10-16T19:50:21.4379140Z [19:50:21]: > Uploaded 59 missing debug information files
2023-10-16T19:50:22.1034060Z [19:50:22]: > File upload complete:
```

### Actual Result

See logs from Step 3 under **Steps to Reproduce**

### Logs

See logs from Step 3 under **Steps to Reproduce**. Application is closed source so providing all build logs isn't feasible, but happy to upload specific logs if requested!

### Additional context

I've previously opened an issue with the sentry fastlane plugin at https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-fastlane-plugin/issues/216.

You can see there that I've tried with several versions of Flutter, all producing the same output.

issue.title: Debug files missing on building Flutter Android on ubuntu
issue.body:
### Environment

What version of the CLI and what OS are you running?

downloads.sentry-cdn.com/sentry-cli/2.20.6/sentry-cli-Linux-x86_64
ubuntu-22.04

### Steps to Reproduce

- Check out `sentry-dart-plugin`
- Change directory to `integration-test`
- Run `flutter pub get`
- Run `flutter build apk`
- Run `flutter build web --source-maps`
- Run `scripts/test.ps1` in `pwsh`

What you did?

File `app.so` is missing in debug symbol upload.

### Expected/Actual Result

File `app.so` is included in debug symbol upload.

What you thought would happen and what actually happened?

We wrote a integration test local server that expects certain calls from `sentry-cli`. The last run that was working reported upload of three files `app.so` and three files `libapp.so`. The first failing run found the same number of debug files overall, but reported six files `libapp.so` as uploaded and none with the name `app.so`. The apk build did produce `app.so` files. See the issue over at `sentry-dart-plugin` for more information.

[Fix ubuntu integration tests #161](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-dart-plugin/issues/161)

### Logs

[When filing a bug report, please attach debug logs, either by using `--log-level=debug` flag or `SENTRY_LOG_LEVEL=debug` environment variable.

Successful Run
https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-dart-plugin/actions/runs/6140635136/job/16659855989

Failing Run
https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-dart-plugin/actions/runs/6221053336/job/16882288167

issue.title: Issue with sourcemaps "sources" properties after injecting (command inject) with sentry-cli since v2.20.0
issue.body:
### Environment

- **@angular/core**: `15.2.8`
- **@ionic/core**: `6.7.4`
- **@capacitor/core**: `4.7.3`
- **@sentry/capacitor**: `0.14.0`
- **@sentry/cli**: `2.21.2`
- **@sentry/angular-ivy**: `7.73.0`
- **OS**: MacOS Sonoma `14.0`

The issue wasn't present in version `v2.19.4` of `sentry-cli` but appeared starting from `v2.20.0`.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build the app for production. After the build, the generated `.js.map` has the following structure:
```json
{
    "version": 3,
    "file": "7442.5a96e681b5941655.js",
    "sources": [
        "./libs/boldor/common/src/lib/pages/debug-page/debug-page.component.html",
        "./libs/boldor/common/src/lib/pages/debug-page/debug-page.component.ts"
    ],
    "sourceRoot": "webpack:///",
    "sourcesContent": [/*...*/],
    "names": [/*...*/],
    "mappings": "..."
}
```
2. Inject the build using the sentry-cli: `sentry-cli sourcemaps inject --org ... --project ... PATH/www`

### Expected Result

I expected the injected `.js.map` to retain the original `"sources"` values, with just the `debug_id` added.

### Actual Result

After injecting with `sentry-cli`, the `.js.map` transforms to:
```json
{
    "version": 3,
    "file": "7442.5a96e681b5941655.js",
    "sources": [
        "webpack:///./libs/boldor/common/src/lib/pages/debug-page/debug-page.component.html",
        "webpack:///./libs/boldor/common/src/lib/pages/debug-page/debug-page.component.ts"
    ],
    "sourceRoot": "webpack:///",
    "sourcesContent": [/*...*/],
    "names": [/*...*/],
    "mappings": "...",
    "debug_id": "..."
}
```
The `"sourceRoot"` value (`webpack:///`) is prepended to every entry in the `"sources"`, preventing the sourcemaps from being correctly applied in the stacktraces on the Sentry web dashboard.

**Additionally**: 
After uploading the sourcemap with `sentry-cli`, the `.js.map` further transforms to:
```json
{
    "version": 3,
    "file": "7442.5a96e681b5941655.js",
    "sources": [
        "webpack:///webpack:///./libs/boldor/common/src/lib/pages/debug-page/debug-page.component.html",
        "webpack:///webpack:///./libs/boldor/common/src/lib/pages/debug-page/debug-page.component.ts"
    ],
    "sourceRoot": "webpack:///",
    "sourcesContent": [/*...*/],
    "names": [/*...*/],
    "mappings": "...",
    "debug_id": "..."
}
```
There is twice `webpack:///` in `"sources"`.

I suspect there might be some misbehaving replacement code introduced in `v2.20.0`.

Note: Uploading sourcemaps via `@sentry/webpack-plugin` doesn't result in these issues. However, due to technical reasons, we prefer uploading sourcemaps through `sentry-cli`.

I don't understand why during `sourcemaps upload` command, on artifacts uploaded on Sentry UI, `sourceRoot` is removed and appended to each `sources` values. It break our stacktrace-sourcemap mapping on Sentry UI. 

With `@sentry/webpack-plugin`, sourcemaps locally generated are same than uploaded : 
```json
{
    "version": 3,
    "file": "7442.1336249b14eae724.js",
    "mappings": "...",
    "names": [...],
    "sourceRoot": "webpack:///",
    "sources": [
        "libs/boldor/common/src/lib/pages/debug-page/debug-page.component.html",
        "libs/boldor/common/src/lib/pages/debug-page/debug-page.component.ts"
    ],
    "sourcesContent": [...],
    "x_google_ignoreList": [],
    "debug_id": "7ce5819d-f3f1-420b-9134-ec57528d4a80",
    "debugId": "7ce5819d-f3f1-420b-9134-ec57528d4a80"
}
```
No any modifications on `sources`. And it works like a charm!

issue.title: URL configuration is overridden and the Root URL of the hosted site is used directly
issue.body:
Version: 2.21.2

.sentrylicrc
`
[defaults]
url=http://my1.com/
`

When I use `sentry-cli releases files upload-sourcemaps`, my URL configuration is overridden and the Root URL of the hosted site is used directly.
In version 1.74.3, the behavior is normal, and the CLI will use the URL I configured to complete the API calls.
In the logs, it can be seen that in version 2.x, the CLI appears to be fetching the API list from the hosted site, and the URL paths inside are absolute paths that use the root URL.

Can someone help me, please?

comment.body:
> Can I ask why it matters if the root URL or the one in your `.sentryclirc` is used? I assume this is a situation where your configured URL redirects to the root URL somehow.

Sorry, I forgot to reply. This is the case, we use the root URL as the URL for internal access to access the Sentry platform, and the url in `.sentryclirc `is the URL for external access. You can also understand that they are different nginx configurations.So when I use `sentrycli`, I want to use the external URL.

issue.title: Add support for $XDG_CONFIG_HOME file
issue.body:
Hi all, this PR adds the support for $XDG_CONFIG_HOME. The default global file is now located at
`$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/sentry/cli.ini` (issue https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-cli/issues/1521).

`env` is still used for local config but `dirs` is still used for `dump_response`, `debug_files` and `cache_dir`. Maybe, at least `cache_dir`, should be moved to `xdg`?

issue.title: sourcemaps explain: Point users towards debug ids

comment.body: Update here: We will likely deprecate the `sentry-cli sourcemaps explain` command since we are gonna have the source maps debugger modal which is gonna be equally powerful and we don't want to maintain two systems.

issue.title: Rebuild sourcemaps explain on top of source-map-debug
issue.body: Sentry has an [API endpoint](https://docs.sentry.io/api/events/debug-issues-related-to-source-maps-for-a-given-event/) called `source-map-debug` with a similar purpose as `sourcemaps explain`. Instead of reimplementing this functionality, `sourcemaps explain` should just query this endpoint. This would make sure that the two always stay in sync.

comment.body: Update here: We will likely deprecate the `sentry-cli sourcemaps explain` command since we are gonna have the source maps debugger modal which is gonna be equally powerful and we don't want to maintain two systems.

issue.title: sentry-cli does not respect the --url parameter on chunk-upload
issue.body:
### Environment

`sentry-cli version: 2.21.2, platform: "darwin", architecture: "arm64"`

We have a self-hosted Sentry instance, set up behind a [Teleport proxy](https://goteleport.com/docs/architecture/proxy/) that takes care of the access-control.

We are using the `--url` parameter to tell the `sentry-cli` how to communicate with our Sentry instance (https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-cli/issues/1763).

### Steps to Reproduce

`sentry-cli --log-level=debug --url https://sentry.internal.corp.<org>.com debug-files upload --type=jvm --org <org> --project <project-name> <path-to-source-bundle> --wait`

### Expected/Actual Result

It appears that `GET /api/0/organizations/<org>/chunk-upload/` returns a full URL path for the chunk upload, which in our case looks like this: `"url":"https://sentry.teleport.internal.corp.<org>.com/api/0/organizations/<org>/chunk-upload/"` (note the **teleport** sub-domain in the URL.

`sentry-cli` then follows this URL with `POST https://sentry.teleport.internal.corp.<org>.com/api/0/organizations/<org>/chunk-upload/` and gets HTTP 302 response, which results in `error: project not found` (see full logs below).

I would expect `sentry-cli` to respect the passed `--url` parameter for the POST operation.

### Logs

```

issue.title: Failing with 429 errors
issue.body:
### Environment

2.11.0

### Steps to Reproduce

Our nightly dev builds running on our CI service (Circle CI) have started routinely failing over the last week at the end of our workflow when we create the release in Sentry, normally on the upload dSYM step. 

After uploading a build to TestFlight our workflow uses sentry CLI to:

* Create a release and deploy in sentry. 
* Set the commits for that release. 
* Upload the dSYM. 

This workflow has worked reliably for months but now it regularly fails due to an HTTP 429 error. 

### Expected Result

Our workflow completes successfully. 

### Actual Result

```
..
[00:16:43]: > Found 1 debug information file
[00:16:43]: > Prepared debug information file for upload
[00:16:43]: error: API request failed
[00:16:43]: caused by: sentry reported an error: unknown error (http status: 429)p
[00:16:43]: ------------------------
```

comment.body:
This issue has gone three weeks without activity. In another week, I will close it.

But! If you comment or otherwise update it, I will reset the clock, and if you label it `Status: Backlog` or `Status: In Progress`, I will leave it alone ... forever!

----

"A weed is but an unloved flower." ― _Ella Wheeler Wilcox_ 🥀

issue.title: Sentry-cli update always asks for elevated permissions
issue.body:
### Environment

What version of the CLI and what OS are you running?
CLI: `2.20.6`, OS: `Windows 10` and `Windows Server 2019`

### Steps to Reproduce

Run `sentry-cli.exe update` in a folder where the executing user has full permissions

### Expected/Actual Result

Expected: Sentry-cli should update without elevation prompt.

Actual: Sentry-cli prompts for admin access, which is a huge problem in containers, because you cannot confirm the prompt, so the process hangs indefinitely.
Also, it outputs `Updated to 2.21.1!` even though the prompt was cancelled!

### Logs
```

comment.body:
This issue has gone three weeks without activity. In another week, I will close it.

But! If you comment or otherwise update it, I will reset the clock, and if you label it `Status: Backlog` or `Status: In Progress`, I will leave it alone ... forever!

----

"A weed is but an unloved flower." ― _Ella Wheeler Wilcox_ 🥀

issue.title: Redesign the updater
issue.body:
As reported in #1759, the updater always asks for elevated permissions on Windows because the check for writeability of the exe doesn't work there. We should rebuild the updater logic to make this sound, for example by using [`self-replace`](https://crates.io/crates/self-replace).

Moreover, I believe the updater should be feature-gated so that package managers like `brew` and `npm` (and `nix` …) can install a version without it, instead of the hacky checks whether `sentry-cli` was installed via a package manager.

Open question: what do we do about auto-sudo? Integrating it with `self-replace` would require some rigmarole.

0.36.9

  • Hopefully fixes the intermittent build errors (#544)

issue.title: Mach-O executable Debug File not uploaded on first sentry-cli call
issue.body:
### Environment

SaaS (https://sentry.io/)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Have a Mach-O executable and a Mach-O debug companion debug files in one folder
2. Upload them to Sentry through the following command:
```
sentry-cli upload-dif -o <org_slug> -p <proj_slug> --auth-token <auth_token> path/to/folder --log-level=debug
```

### Expected Result

Both files are uploaded at the same time.

### Actual Result

The terminal logs indicate that both files were uploaded.
![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/81985895/bad03e53-9e46-4362-b83f-b710c2db4019)
![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/81985895/bca9832c-344b-4737-b074-739d7ccd6ae6)

However, only the Mach-O debug companion is uploaded.

Upon running the same command, the terminal logs indicate that there is nothing to upload
![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/81985895/0b34dae0-39fd-4fef-a149-ccf94c2eeb6c)
![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/81985895/85f63a50-6fac-4941-bc12-e995ef358058)

And that is when the Mach-O executable is actually uploaded on Sentry.

I ran this command twice with a 1 hour difference between the execution of the two:
![Screenshot 2023-09-26 at 14 10 07](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/81985895/d0671c76-2465-4a95-b092-44484ec93b95)
![Screenshot 2023-09-26 at 14 10 16](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/81985895/0cacd185-03c4-444d-ab5a-c6b7fb4b8d70)

Adding the full debug logs from both command executions in the linked internal ticket.

### Product Area

Other

### Link

https://dragonfruit-dev.sentry.io/settings/projects/unity/debug-symbols/

### DSN

_No response_

### Version

_No response_

┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Improvement](https://getsentry.atlassian.net/browse/FEEDBACK-1948) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

issue.title: Sourcemaps not working for server bundles
issue.body:
Hi

### Environment

What version of the CLI and what OS are you running?

I use this command in our dockerfile: `RUN curl -sL https://sentry.io/get-cli/ | bash`

### Steps to Reproduce

In dockerfile: `RUN sentry-cli sourcemaps inject ${STATIC_FILES_PATH}`

In GH Workflow:
```
sentry-cli releases new $SENTRY_RELEASE --project flow-node
sentry-cli releases files $SENTRY_RELEASE upload-sourcemaps ./sentry-static-files/server --dist $SENTRY_DIST --project flow-node --ignore *date-fns_locale*
sentry-cli releases finalize $SENTRY_RELEASE --project flow-node
```

### Expected/Actual Result

We expect the sourcemaps to  work for our app server bundles (bundled with webpack).
They already work for our service files which aren't bundled.
They also work for our client bundles which have `--url-prefix` set though

### Logs

The bundle contains `//# sourceMappingURL=main.bef100.js.map` but no longer any `debugId`. DebugIds not being injected was sovled in a previous issue that I created but it has perhaps resurfaced in a different form? https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-cli/issues/1681

In the sourcemap `debugId` seems to have been replaced by `mappings`?
`"mappings":"yKAIA,MAAMA,GAA0BC,EAAAA,EAAAA,IAAS,CAADC,SAAA,GAAAC,YAAA,6BAAAC,QAAAC,GAAA,MAAAC,EAAA,KAAAC,QAAAF,GAAA,gBAAAH,SAAAI,MAAAE,EAAAA,EAAAF,EAAA,EAAAG,YACvCA,IACQ,wRACPC,aAAAL,GAAA,MAAAC,EAAA,KAAAC,QAAAF,GAAA,YAAAH,....`

comment.body: @tranan89 Great! Glad you could solve it.
